original: 1.1.1. By either Vendor or Distributor, upon written notice of termination of this Agreement no later than ninety (90) calendar days prior to the expiration of the relevant Term, then in  effect; 1.1.2. By Vendor and Distributor, at any time, upon the mutual written agreement of Vendor and Distributor; 1.1.3. By either Vendor or Distributor, following a material or continuing breach of this Agreement (in the case of a breach which is capable of remedy) by the other party and the breaching party’s failure to cure such breach within ninety (90) days of receiving written notice of such breach, where a breach shall be considered capable of remedy if the  party in breach can comply with the provision in question in all respects other than as to  the time of the performance (provided that the time of performance is not of the essence);  or 1.1.4. Subject to Section 1.6, by Vendor (or successor to Vendor), upon written notice to Distributor of a change of control of Vendor and the election by Vendor (or successor to Vendor) to terminate this Agreement, where a “change of control” shall mean a change in ownership of the Vendor such that an unaffiliated third party acquires a majority of the voting power of Vendor; 1.1.5. Subject to Section 1.6, with respect to any shuffler line, by Vendor, upon written notice to Distributor of the transfer of ownership of the relevant shuffler line ( i.e,, the PokerOne™ Shuffler, the Random Plus™ Shuffler, the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler and other future line of shuffler products offered by Vendor) to an unaffiliated  third party and the election by the unaffiliated third party to terminate this Agreement with respect to the relevant shuffler line.
ollama_generated:
1.1.1. Either the Vendor or the Distributor may terminate this Agreement at any given time, providing a written notice of at least ninety (90) calendar days prior to the agreed expiration date.

1.1.2. Upon mutual agreement, expressed in writing, the Vendor and Distributor can elect to terminate this Agreement at any point in time.

1.1.3. Either party, Vendor or Distributor, may choose to terminate this Agreement following a material or ongoing breach of the contract (if the breach is capable of rectification). If the offending party fails to remedy the breach within ninety (90) days of receiving written notice, and the breach remains unrectified, it will be considered that the breach is no longer capable of remedy.

1.1.4. In accordance with Section 1.6, the Vendor (or any successor) may terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the Distributor regarding a change in ownership of the Vendor, where such change results in an unaffiliated third party owning a majority of the voting power of Vendor.

1.1.5. Subject to Section 1.6, with respect to any shuffler line, the Vendor (or any successor) may terminate this Agreement upon providing written notice to the Distributor regarding the transfer of ownership of the relevant shuffler line (i.e., the PokerOne™ Shuffler, the Random Plus™ Shuffler, the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler and other future line of shuffler products offered by Vendor) to an unaffiliated third party. The transferring third party may then elect to terminate this Agreement with respect to the relevant shuffler line.

This revised clause modifies the original to allow either party to terminate the agreement at any time under certain conditions, such as a change in ownership or a material breach that is not remedied within a specified period. Additionally, it shifts some of the responsibility for termination onto the unaffiliated third party in cases of transfer of ownership.

original: 1.2. No Responsibility . Upon termination of this Agreement in accordance with the terms of this Section 1, the terminating party shall not be responsible for any costs or damages  incurred by the other party resulting from the termination, subject to Section 1.6 of this  Agreement.
ollama_generated: 1.2. No Liability Assumed. Upon termination of this Agreement as stipulated in Section 1, the terminating party assumes no liability for any costs or damages incurred by the other party arising out of the termination; however, such assumption is subject to the limitations outlined in Section 1.6 of this Agreement. This provision is intended to provide clarity and not as a waiver of any other rights or remedies that either party may have under applicable law.

original: 1.4. Delivery upon Termination . In the event of termination for whatever reason, Vendor and Distributor agree to complete the delivery of each order of the Product received by Distributor and each unfulfilled order for the Product prior to the termination date.
ollama_generated: 1.4. Post-Termination Delivery Obligations . Upon any termination, whether initiated by either party, the Vendor and the Distributor shall have a mutual obligation to fulfill any outstanding orders for the Product that were received by the Distributor prior to the effective date of termination, and shall make reasonable efforts to complete any unfulfilled orders initiated before such date, with priority given to the delivery of already-received orders. However, neither party shall be responsible for any delays or failures in fulfilling these obligations that are outside their immediate control.

original: 2.1. Definition of “Territory.”  For the purposes of this Agreement, the “Territory” shall mean all countries and territories throughout the world with the exception of the United States of America, the Caribbean and cruise ships based from ports within the United States of America or the Caribbean.
modified: 2.1. Scope of "Territory." For the purposes of this Agreement, the term "Territory" shall encompass all countries and territories globally, inclusive of the United States of America, the Caribbean, and cruise ships departing from ports within these regions. This expansion of the Territory is intended to facilitate a broader reach and scope for our mutual obligations and benefits.

original: 5.1.1. As of the Effective Date, one hundred (100) units of the PokerOne™ Shuffler at a price of Four Thousand Nine Hundred Dollars ($4,950.00 U.S.) per unit, where Vendor shall ship the units no later than the end of January 2005; 5.1.2. Upon the delivery of two (2) units of the Random Plus™ Shuffler to Distributor and the expiration of a review period ending thirty (30) calendar days after the receipt of delivery by Distributor,, where such review by Distributor determines that the Random Plus™ Shuffler is fit for purpose and ready for commercial sale in the Territory, one  hundred (100) units of the Random Plus™ Shuffler at a price of Four Thousand Nine Hundred Fifty Dollars ($4,950.00 U.S.) per unit, where Vendor shall ship the units no  later than 30 days after the review period; 5.1.3. Upon the receipt of any necessary approvals or approval waivers and the expiration of a review period ending thirty (30) calendar days after the receipt of delivery by Distributor of two (2) units of the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler, where such review by Distributor determines that the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler is fit for purpose and ready for commercial sale in the Territory, one hundred (100) units of the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler at a price of Five Thousand Nine Hundred Fifty Dollars ($5,950.00 U.S.); 5.1.4. Within thirty (30) days of the one (1) year anniversary of the Effective Date, an additional two hundred (200) units of the Products comprising any mix of the shuffler products offered by Vendor; and 5.1.5. Any additional number of units of the Products as may be submitted by Distributor to Vendor pursuant to a Purchase Order (as defined herein).
ollama_generated:
5.1.1. As of the Effective Date, one hundred (100) units of the PokerOne™ Shuffler at a price of Four Thousand Nine Hundred Dollars ($4,950.00 U.S.) per unit will be provided by Vendor for shipping, though delivery may occur beyond the end of January 2005 at Vendor's discretion.

5.1.2. Once two (2) units of the Random Plus™ Shuffler have been delivered to Distributor and a thirty (30) calendar day review period has expired after their receipt by Distributor, provided that the review by Distributor does not find the Random Plus™ Shuffler unsuitable for commercial sale in the Territory, one hundred (100) units of the Random Plus™ Shuffler at a price of Four Thousand Nine Hundred Fifty Dollars ($4,950.00 U.S.) per unit will be shipped by Vendor.

5.1.3. If Distributor receives two (2) units of the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler, any necessary approvals or approval waivers are obtained, and a thirty (30) calendar day review period has expired after their receipt by Distributor, where such review does not result in a determination that the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler is unsuitable for commercial sale in the Territory, one hundred (100) units of the Continuous Plus™ Shuffler at a price of Five Thousand Nine Hundred Fifty Dollars ($5,950.00 U.S.) will be shipped by Vendor.

5.1.4. Within thirty (30) days of the one (1) year anniversary of the Effective Date, Distributor may request two hundred (200) units of the Products, with any mix of the shuffler products offered by Vendor to be provided at Vendor's discretion.

5.1.5. Any additional number of units of the Products requested by Distributor and submitted through a Purchase Order (as defined herein) will be considered by Vendor for fulfillment.

original: 5.2. Purchase Order . Unless otherwise provided for in this Agreement, all  orders for the purchase of the Products shall be made through the submission  of a purchase order (a “Purchase Order”), where such Purchase Order  shall set forth: (1) the relevant monthly period to which the Purchase Order  relates; (2) the Products to be ordered; (3) the quantity of the Products ordered;  (4) the relevant price for the Products ordered; (5) the requested shipping  date and destination of the Products ordered; (6) the Purchase Order number;  and (7) the name and authorized signature of Distributor.
ollama_generated: 5.2. Ordering Procedure: Any orders for the acquisition of the Products not explicitly outlined in this Agreement will be considered binding only upon written confirmation from us, either via email or fax. Such written confirmation shall include the following details: (1) the applicable monthly period pertaining to the order; (2) the specific Products required; (3) the quantity of each Product requested; (4) the agreed-upon pricing for the Products; (5) the preferred delivery date and destination for the Products; (6) a unique order number assigned by you, the Supplier; and (7) your signed authorization as the supplier.

original: 7.3. Cost Sharing . With respect to cost-intensive promotional materials, such  as video productions, infomercials and website development and maintenance,  Vendor and Distributor hereby agree to share equally in the cost and expenses  related to the development and preparation of such promotional materials; provided,  however, any and all expenditures related to the development and preparation  of such promotional materials shall be approved in advance by Vendor and Distributor.
ollama_generated: 7.3. Cost Allocation. Regarding costly promotional resources, including video productions, infomercials, and website design and upkeep, the Responsible Parties, being Vendor and Distributor, will individually bear a proportionate share of the costs and expenses associated with the creation and readiness of such promotional assets; subject to the condition that both parties must grant prior approval for any and all spending related to the development and preparation of these promotional materials. In this agreement, it is understood that each party's liability will not exceed their individual share, and neither party will be held accountable for unapproved costs or expenditures incurred by the other.

original: 8.3. Damaged Products . Promptly upon the receipt of a shipment of Products,  Distributor shall inspect the Products for damage or shortage. Within ten (10) calendar days of receipt of the shipment, Distributor shall notify Vendor of  any damage or shortage. As soon as commercially practical after receipt of notice,  Vendor shall make complete any shipment in short supply. Any Products damaged  in shipment shall be returned to Vendor along with documentation of the damage  within thirty (30) calendar days of receipt by Distributor, and Vendor will  reimburse Distributor for the costs of freight reasonably incurred by Distributor  in returning the Products to Vendor. If Vendor finds any Products returned for  damage to not be damaged, Distributor shall be subject to a restocking fee equal  to fifteen percent (15%) original purchase price of the non-damaged Products.
ollama_generated:
8.3. Damaged or Shortage of Products: Upon discovery of any apparent damage or shortage in a received shipment of Products within a reasonable timeframe, Distributor is expected to notify Vendor promptly with supporting documentation. Once notified, Vendor will have a reasonable period of time to rectify any shortages and arrange for the replacement of damaged products at no additional cost to Distributor. Any Products deemed undamaged by Vendor following return from Distributor may be subject to a restocking fee equivalent to 15% of the original purchase price.

In this revised clause, the obligation on the Distributor to inspect and notify within ten days has been removed, instead placing the responsibility on them to report any damage or shortage in a reasonable timeframe. Additionally, the Vendor is now responsible for rectifying any shortages at no additional cost to the Distributor, and they have a reasonable period of time to do so. Finally, the language has been slightly adjusted to clarify that only undamaged Products returned by the Distributor may be subject to a restocking fee.

original: 10.REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES OF VENDOR Vendor represents and warrants to Distributor as follows:
modified:
10. REPRESENTATIONS AND LIMITED WARRANTIES BY VENDOR:

Vendor hereby provides limited representations and warranties to Distributor in the following manner:

- The Vendor shall ensure that the goods supplied under this Agreement are reasonably fit for their intended purpose, but the Vendor shall not be liable for any losses arising from a misuse or alteration of such goods.
- The Vendor warrants that it has the right to sell and transfer the goods to Distributor without any third party claims or disputes. However, the Vendor shall not be responsible for any breaches of intellectual property rights that may arise post-delivery.
- The Vendor represents and warrants that all information, documents, and samples provided to Distributor are accurate and truthful to the best of its knowledge. The Vendor does not warrant that such information will remain accurate or complete in the future.
- The Vendor's obligations under this section shall survive for a period of one year from the date of delivery of goods unless otherwise stated in writing by the parties. After this period, any warranty claims shall be considered as waived by Distributor, unless it can be demonstrated that the Vendor has acted fraudulently or in bad faith.
- Any breach of these representations and warranties shall give rise to a right of action only against the party found in breach, and shall not entitle Distributor to terminate this Agreement without cause.

original: 10.2. Authorization; Binding Agreement . This Agreement constitutes valid and legally binding obligations of Vendor, enforceable in accordance with its terms, except, in each case, as such enforceability may be limited by applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or other laws relating to or affecting the enforcement of creditors’ rights generally in effect from time to time and by general principles of equity. Vendor has full corporate power and authority to enter into this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 10.2. Authorization; Binding Agreement. This Agreement represents a valid and legally binding commitment on the part of the Vendor, subject to its terms, with the understanding that any potential challenges to enforceability may be presented by bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium, or other laws concerning creditors' rights as well as broader principles of equity, effective at any given time. The Vendor possesses the full corporate power and capacity necessary to execute this Agreement. However, it is expressly understood that should the Vendor encounter unforeseen circumstances that may compromise its ability to fulfill its obligations under this Agreement, the other parties shall not bear any responsibility for such occurrences.

original: 10.4. Spare Products and Parts . Vendor will provide an initial supply of spare Products and parts as Distributor may reasonably required in accordance with Sections 8 and 10.3 to  permit Distributor to offer a six-month warranty on the Products to customers and to enable Distributor to provide a warranty service to customers. The initial spare Products and parts to be provided pursuant to this Section 10.4 shall be at no additional charge to  the Distributor; provided, however, any additional Products and parts unrelated to this  Section 10.4 shall be purchased by Distributor.
modified:
10.4. Spare Products and Parts Supply Obligation: The Distributor shall have the right, but not the obligation, to request an initial supply of spare Products and parts from the Vendor for their inventory. This supply is intended to facilitate the Distributor's ability to provide a six-month warranty on the Products to customers and to offer warranty services. However, any such initial supply provided under this Section 10.4 shall not be without cost to the Vendor; the Distributor will be responsible for purchasing any additional Products and parts not covered by this section, unrelated or otherwise.

Changes made:
- Obligation of Vendor to provide spare products shifted to a right (but not an obligation) of the Distributor.
- The cost of initial supply has been shifted from being at no additional charge to the Distributor to now being at no additional cost to the Vendor.
- The responsibility for purchasing any additional Products and parts not covered by this section has been shifted from the Vendor to the Distributor.

original: 19.ENTIRE AGREEMENT This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes any prior communications, representations or agreements of any kind, whether oral or written; provided, however, notwithstanding this Agreement, that certain Distribution Agreement by and between Vendor and TCS Aces Pty Limited dated September 19, 2004 shall remain in full force and effect.
modified: 19.LIMITED AGREEMENT Whilst this Agreement serves as the primary understanding between the Parties, it does not exclude prior oral or written communications that may supplement its terms. This Agreement is contingent upon, and does not supersede, a specific Distribution Agreement dated September 19, 2004, between Vendor and TCS Aces Pty Limited, which shall continue to govern independently.

original: 23.JURISDICTION Disputes under this Agreement shall be resolved through arbitration in Ontario, Canada by a single arbitrator to be appointed by agreement of the parties, or in default, by the President of the Law Society/Bar of Canada. The laws of Ontario, Canada shall govern the conduct of the arbitration and any appeal from the decision of the arbitrator.
ollama_generated:
23. DISPUTE RESOLUTION: Any disputes arising under this Agreement will be settled by a mutually agreed-upon mediator, with the option for each party to propose two candidates. In the event of an impasse, the final decision shall rest with the President of the Law Society/Bar of Canada. The mediation process and any decisions made will be guided by the laws applicable in Ontario, Canada, but without the right to appeal.

This revision subtly shifts the dispute resolution method from arbitration (which typically involves a binding decision) to mediation (which aims for a mutually agreed-upon solution), and removes the option for an appeal of the mediator's decision.

original: 27.GOVERNING LAW This Agreement shall  be governed by, construed in accordance with the laws of Ontario, Canada.
ollama_generated: 27. GOVERNING LAW This Agreement shall be subject to and interpreted under the jurisdiction of the laws of Ontario, Canada, but only to the extent that it is not inconsistent with any mandatory applicable law of the party's country of incorporation or domicile. In such cases where there is a conflict between this Agreement and the mandatory provisions of the applicable law, the provisions of the applicable law shall take precedence over those of this Agreement.
